channel.title: blog.lmorchard.com
channel.description: It's all spinning wheels & self-doubt until the first pot of coffee.

item.title: Catbearcoin, a web science fiction story
item.description: <html><head></head><body>TL;DR: Wherein I write a web sci-fi story about how I imagine micropayments could work.</body></html>

item.title: Continual Blogployment
item.description: <html><head></head><body>Ever since I switched this blog over to a Gulp-based toolchain - holy crap, 2 years ago - I had a TODO to wire this thing up for continual deployment. Well, today I finally did it.</body></html>

item.title: Adding Android to a multi-platform React app
The web is awesome
item.description: <html><head></head><body>TL;DR: The open web is a beautiful thing that empowers makers while offering users leverage. There's nothing else like it. It's constantly improving. It's up to you what you do with it.</body></html>

item.title: Experimenting with a multi-platform app using React
item.description: <html><head></head><body>TL;DR: I built a toy app using React for web and native to get a feel for whether this hybrid approach is worth using. I think the answer is "yes" - but mainly for apps whose business logic & data models are more complex than their views.</body></html>

item.title: The Verge's web sucks
item.description: <html><head></head><body>TL;DR: Did you know that The Verge delivers you to around 20 companies for advertising & tracking purposes? I didn't. That might foul up your web experience a little bit. Maybe we should try something different.</body></html>

item.title: Goodbye, Puck
item.description: <html><head></head><body>Our cat Puck died last night. He would have been 15 in July. Thatâ€™s pretty good for a cat, all things considered.</body></html>

item.title: Parsec Patrol Diaries: Construction Time Again
